resources.string: While traveling in an area where the time is different, add a clock for home
Swipe left to snooze or right to dismiss
Opens the main Android screensaver settings
Set an alarm to access this setting
No alarm scheduled for this time
%s alarm can\'t be dismissed yet, still more than 24 hours away
Your bedtime stops at %1$s after %2$s of sleep.
only important calls can reach you
Do not disturb for bedtime mode
Only calls from starred contacts, repeat callers, and alarms can reach you
Make your wallpaper darker. App icons, widgets, and notifications won\'t be affected

► Light, dark or system theme;

► Customizable screensaver;

► Material design and dynamic colors;

► Swipe to delete an alarm;

► Duplicate an alarm;

► Flip and shake action to dismiss/postpone alarm;

► Turn off/postpone the alarm with the power button or volume buttons;

► %s

To ensure that the application works properly, some of your device settings must be changed:

• DO NOT DISTURB;

• BATTERY OPTIMIZATION;

• NOTIFICATIONS;

%s • STORAGE (optional);

Depending on the Android version of your device, some of these settings are already optimized (e.g. notifications).

You can change them now or later in the permission management settings:
Are you sure you want to leave the application?
Shows the permissions necessary for the application to work properly
Are you sure you want to revoke this permission?
One or more essential permissions are denied. Display the Permissions management page to activate them.

By default, the Android system configures all user-installed apps to be optimized to save battery life. 

While this is acceptable for many apps, this app is an alarm app and often causes issues if configured to optimize battery. Once enabled, the Android system can kill the app at any time and/or cancel alarms it has scheduled, which would adversely affect the app's operation. 

We recommend whitelisting this app from battery optimizations.

The app allows you to set the ringing volume for alarms. Before the alarm is triggered, the app attempts to change the volume of the system alarm to the volume you\'ve set. \n\nTo change the volume, the permission to modify the Do Not Disturb settings is required for Android Nougat and above. If it is not granted, the app will simply not set the volume before triggering the alarm.

In addition to setting alarms, this app also has a timer, stopwatch, and bedtime mode. \n\nIn order for notifications to appear correctly for all modules and especially for the alarm to be triggered, we recommend activating notifications for this application.
Since Android 14, in order for the alarm to be triggered when the screen is off, it\'s imperative that Full Screen Notifications permission is enabled

This permission is required if you want to choose an alarm tone different from the default alarm tone of your device. This therefore allows the application to play audio and music files on your device. 

Since Android 13, we request a specific permission that allow us to read only the music and audio files and nothing else. 
However, in earlier Android versions, this is not supported, so we have to ask permission to read external storage.

It appears that you have denied this permission in the Android system dialog. 
Android will not allow this application to create this permission request dialog again. 

Would you like to go to Settings and allow this permission?
